docs.snippet: LONDON, May 24 -- Coincident with the first German High Command communique on the Battle of Crete, in which the Nazis claimed possession of the western end of the island, the British made known that since yesterday long-range bombers and fighters of...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, May 24 -- Coincident with the first German High Command communique on the Battle of Crete, in which the Nazis claimed possession of the western end of the island, the British made known that since yesterday long-range bombers and fighters of the Royal Air Force had been attacking Maleme airfield, where the Germans are entrenched.
docs.abstract: RAF, Anzacs and Greek troops attack Maleme

docs.snippet: LONDON, May 24 -- The 42,100-ton battle cruiser Hood, pride of the British Fleet and the world's biggest fighting vessel, was blown up today by an "unlucky hit" scored on a munitions magazine by the new German battleship Bismarck in an engagement off...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, May 24 -- The 42,100-ton battle cruiser Hood, pride of the British Fleet and the world's biggest fighting vessel, was blown up today by an "unlucky hit" scored on a munitions magazine by the new German battleship Bismarck in an engagement off Greenland, the Admiralty announced.
docs.abstract: Brit battle cruiser Hood sunk off Greenland by shell from German battleship Bismarck which hit Hood's munition magazine; 1,300 believed lost; Bismarck's sister ship Tirpitz believed at sea; Spanish news agency repts Brit warships at Gibraltar suddenly left for Atlantic; Hood and Bismarck illus; Fleet Adm G Luetjens, Bismarck Comdr, por

headline.main: HOOD IS BLOWN UP; World's Biggest Warship Sunk Between Iceland and Greenland 1,300 FEARED KILLED Damaged German Vessel Being Pursued After Flotillas' Clash HOOD IS BLOWN UP BY THE BISMARCK

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 27 -- The East Room of the White House was a whirring, glittering bedlam of movie cameras and Hollywood lights tonight when Franklin D. Roosevelt delivered his Declaration of Intentions to a belligerent world.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 27 -- The East Room of the White House was a whirring, glittering bedlam of movie cameras and Hollywood lights tonight when Franklin D. Roosevelt delivered his Declaration of Intentions to a belligerent world.
